Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Navigation class is used to make the robot navigate around the playing field.

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public static boolean travelTo​(Point destination,
                               boolean isTail,
                               boolean careObs,
                               boolean rightCorrection,
                               boolean careObsHard)
        Travels to the given destination. we isTail is true, will use the US_SENSOR_TO_WHEEL_DIST to correct the movement so car will not push too much
        Parameters:
        destination - the point the robot must end up
        isTail - whether we are in the process of pushing a box

      • lineCorrection

        public static void lineCorrection​(int leftRemain,
                                  int rightRemain)
        This method will stop left motor if left color sensor sees a black line and same for right motor. once both are stopped, it's going make them move again
        Parameters:
        leftRemain -
        rightRemain -

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo​(double angle)
        Turns the robot with a minimal angle towards the given input angle in degrees, no matter what its current orientation is. This method is different from turnBy().
        Parameters:
        angle - angle where the robot must turn to

      • getDestinationAngle

        public static double getDestinationAngle​(Point current,
                                         Point destination)
        Returns the angle that the robot should point towards to face the destination in degrees.

      • minimalAngle

        public static double minimalAngle​(double initialAngle,
                                  double destAngle)
        finds the minimal using trigonmetry
        Parameters:
        initialAngle - current heading of the robot
        destAngle - final heading of the robot
        Returns:
        the signed minimal angle in degrees from initial angle to destination angle (deg).

                                     Point p2)
        Parameters:
        p1 - first point
        p2 - second point
        Returns:
        the distance between the two points in tile lengths (feet).

        public static Point getTunnelStart​(Point ll,
                                   Point ur,
                                   Point startCorner)
        Gets the point to which the robot must travel to to get from its start location to start point of the tunnel
        Parameters:
        ll - lower left corner of the tunnel
        ur - upper right corner of the tunnel
        start - start corner of the robot
        Returns:
        the start point of the tunnel

        Parameters:
        ll - lower left corner of the tunnel
        ur - upper right corner of the tunnel
        start - Start corner of the robot
        Returns:
        end point of the tunnel

      • crossBridge

        public static void crossBridge​(Point TNG_LL,
                               Point TNG_UR,
                               Point TNG_startPoint)
        After the localization phase, the robot is directed to navigate across the tunnel.
        Parameters:
        TNG_LL - lower left point of the tunnel
        TNG_UR - upper right corner of the tunnel
        TNG_startPoint - start point of the robot based on the corner it has started in

      • getAllPointsInRegion

        public static java.util.List<Point> getAllPointsInRegion​(Region r)
        calculates all the points found in a specific region
        Parameters:
        r - region corresponds to the search zone
        Returns:
        a list of all the way points the robot must travel to in the search zone

      • moveInSearchZone

        public static void moveInSearchZone​(Region sz,
                                    RampEdge ramp,
                                    long initialTime)
        This method allows the robot to traverse to and from each grid point in the search zone if it sees the box it will bring it to the pi. If there is no time to continue on the search path the robot is directed home.
        Parameters:
        sz - search zone region
        ramp - coordinates of the ramp
        initialTime - the simulation time

      • goHome

        public static void goHome​(Point TNG_LL,
                          Point TNG_UR,
                          Point TNG_startPoint)
        The robot is directed to its initial start position. The robot will cross the bridge back to its start position
        Parameters:
        TNG_LL - lower left corner of the tunnel
        TNG_UR - upper right corner of the tunnel
        TNG_startPoint - the start point the robot has initially started at

      • roughtTheta

        public static double roughtTheta​(double t)
        approximates an angle to the nearest 90 degrees
        Parameters:
        t - angle to approximate
        Returns:
        Angle in degrees

      • rampRegionFromEdge

        public static Region rampRegionFromEdge​(RampEdge re)
        Calculates the region where the ramp is located based on the ramp edge points
        Parameters:
        re - ramp edge region
        Returns:
        a region where the ramp is located

      • removeDuplicated

        public static java.util.List<Point> removeDuplicated​(java.util.List<Point> SZList,
                                                     java.util.List<Point> rampList)
        Removes the points that are blocked off by the ramp and the bucket
        Parameters:
        SZList - Initial search zone list containing all the way points to travel in the search zone
        rampList - the list of points that the ramp is located on.
        Returns:
        Returns a updated search zone list.

      • putInPit

        public static void putInPit​(RampEdge re)
        Once the robot has located a box, it will navigate to the ramp, then on the ramp to drop the box in the pit.
        Parameters:
        re - the location of the ramp
